title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4.13 - False compensation claims prohibited
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4.13 - False compensation claims prohibited

State Regulations

No person registered by the commission shall make a false
statement for the purpose of obtaining any benefit or payment under any State

Workers' Compensation Law or under the Federal Longshoremen and Harbor Workers

Compensation Act. Any violation of this section shall be deemed by the
commission, in the case of a checker, to constitute an act which is
inconsistent with the possession of good character and integrity under section
5-n of the Waterfront Commission Act, and, in the case of a longshoreman, to
constitute the longshoreman a danger to the public peace or safety under
article VIII of the Act. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
4.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
